meanings.sent1: I suddenly realise I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: She will realise the importance of studying for exams.
meanings.sent3: When I realise I left my phone in the car, I have to go back for it.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, I realise the day is coming to an end.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the library, I realise how loud my stomach growls.

meanings.sent1: The artist will realise her vision on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: With hard work, we can realise our dreams.
meanings.sent3: I realise a new recipe by mixing different ingredients together.
meanings.sent4: The architect will realise the building design in the coming months.
meanings.sent5: Through dedication, we can realise great achievements.

meanings.sent1: To pay off debts, he had to realise his investments.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to realise some of its assets to fund expansion.
meanings.sent3: When in need of cash, you can realise the value of your possessions.
meanings.sent4: She had to realise her savings to cover unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: In times of financial trouble, it may be necessary to realise assets for liquidity.

meanings.sent1: The architect will realise the building plans into a physical structure.
meanings.sent2: Through hard work, we can realise our ideas into tangible results.
meanings.sent3: I realise my dream of traveling by booking a plane ticket.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor will realise his artistic vision in the form of a statue.
meanings.sent5: With determination, we can realise our aspirations into reality.
